channel.title: Public void setitem error help?

item.title: Public void setitem error help?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

no, just no. you’re doing everything wrong. I dont know what you’re trying to do but even if you get this working it’s going to crash your game. You’re saying that you want an interface that was put in by the user to be displayed 999 times, and then set the players items to the same number that was put in into the chatbox. A ‘for’ loop doesnt give you an item array.

For example:

for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
   System.out.println(i);
}

Simply prints out:

0
1
2
3
4... all the way to 1000

to make an int[] array you do this BEFORE a for loop.

int[] integerArray = new int[1000]
for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
   integerArray[i] = i;
}

And this sets the int[] array to:

integerArray[0] = 0;
integerArray[1] = 1;
integerArray[2] = 2;
... and so on to 1000...

Read full topic

item.title: Public void setitem error help?
item.dc:creator: @Quintorz Quintorz
item.description:
@Quintorz wrote:

hey i was trying to find a way to find out what child id was what and so on and how to place items on a interface ive done it before like 5-7 months ago… but i cnt seem to do it again

my error is:

palidino76\rs2\io\packets\Commands.java:133: error: incompatible types: int cann ot be converted to int[] p.frames.setItems(p, Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), i, i, i, i); ^ Note: Some messages have been simplified; recompile with -Xdiags:verbose to get full output 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

my command to test it is:

if(cmd[0].equals("tessst")){ for(int i = 1; i < 1000; i++){ p.frames.showInterface(p, Integer.parseInt(cmd[1])); p.frames.setItems(p, Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), i, i, i, i); } }

and the method:

public void setItems(Player p, int interfaceId, int childId, int type, int[] itemArray, int[] itemAmt) { if (p == null || p.stream == null || p.disconnected[0]) { return; } p.stream.createFrameVarSizeWord(255); p.stream.writeWord(interfaceId); p.stream.writeWord(childId); p.stream.writeWord(type); p.stream.writeWord(itemArray.length); for (int i = 0; i < itemArray.length; i++) { if (itemAmt[i] > 254) { p.stream.writeByteS(255); p.stream.writeDWord_v2(itemAmt[i]); } else { p.stream.writeByteS(itemAmt[i]); } p.stream.writeWordBigEndian(itemArray[i] + 1); } p.stream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); }

what am i doing wrong?

Read full topic
